website_summaries.verdict: A handy mixer with professional mixing action that includes a useful fold setting.
pros: Mixes in the same pattern as a KitchenAid
Mixing head spins while it rotates
Buttons are easy to use and easy to understand
Includes a suction at the bottom of the stand to keep the mixer stable
Lighter weight than the all-metal mixers
cons: The design on this mixer can make it a little difficult to add ingredients without stopping the mixer and lifting the lid

customer_reviews.title: Black soot / powder coming off dough blade
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE - black soot / powder is coming off dough blade after first use . If we didn’t notice we would have been eating it mixed into the dough . Do NOT buy this product !!
customer_reviews.author: Ashish Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Nearly Useless
customer_reviews.text: Amazon promptly accepted a return on this item. I had high hopes after reading reviews -- now wondering how many of the reviews were legit. The mixer is much noisier than advertised, but the worst part is the design of the mixing accessories and bowl. Neither the paddle nor the whisk could mix two eggs. They just turned in the air while the liquid sat in the bottom of the bowl undisturbed. This makes the mixer useless for most recipes. If you are someone who thinks stirring a box cake mix by hand is too exhausting, this mixer will be okay for you. Otherwise, forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schulman

customer_reviews.title: Issues with the hook, but rest is fine
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm quiet happy about the product doing its job. I like the fact that you can control the speeds when mixing. However, the booklet that came with it and most of the reviews said that the parts are dishwasher safe. That is NOT completely true! Like any other person, I washed the bowl and the different attachments by placing them on the top rack in the dishwasher to The hook attachment was put into the dishwasher. But surprisingly, the hook turned out to be a totally different color. It also leaves that dark metal resedue if/when you touch it. Ladies, please be careful, wash the hook with your hands.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got me a chessy little handheld mixer for christmas one year, and it worked fine for about two years, when it gave up right in the middle of a cheesecake I was making. So I decided since I was dabbling in a little more baking than before, I wanted to go with a stand mixer this time, and I didnt want to spend an arm and a leg. I just used it tonight to make three loaves of banana bread! They turned out great! I love how easy the mixer is to use, clean and store. Its definitely a winner in my book. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MJ Grant

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought a KitchenAid :(
customer_reviews.text: Completely disappointed. Doesn't do its purpose as the contents needing to be mixed just get pushed to the outside and bottom of the bowl where the blender doesn't reach. I've tried blending a variety of items from egg whites to cake batter to bread dough. I tried scraping the bowl every few seconds, but if I have to do that during the whole process, I might as well just mix it by hand. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Wando

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive my mixer then I used it, I could have lived with the mixing tool not scraping the sides and having to stop every 30 seconds to scrape the bowl; but it was the tool always falling out if the batter is to "heavy". Don't waste your money, if you're looking for a stand mixer save up for the Kitchen Aid I know I am!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not put the dough hook in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.text: What I like: It's small and light weight, so I can store it away when it's not in use. It's not designed to win a beauty award or make your neighbors jealous. What I don't like: Do not put the dough hook in the dishwasher! I washed the dough hook many times by hand and it was fine. One run through the dish washer stripped the finish, and now it sheds black aluminum oxide into everything. Useless. I went to the hamilton beach website to order a new dough hook for $25 including shipping.
customer_reviews.author: SurferJeff

customer_reviews.title: Happy as a pig in mud!
customer_reviews.text: I don't bake, period. However I do make bath products including bubble bars which are rather like dough. This stand beater is perfect for my needs. The features that I think are applicable for baking are: It's extremely light weight which is a pro for me as I move it from counter to counter quite frequently. The suction feet are super strong so it's deifinitely not going anywhere when it's turned on. The bowl is nice and deep so when I'm mixing powdery substances (similar to flour) less poufs out. I just saw the stainless steel bowl selling separately elsewhere for $98!!! Definitely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ORiley

customer_reviews.title: Great budget-friendly mixer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stand mixer for a great price!! Nice budget-friendly alternative to an expensive mixer, came with 3 attachments as well
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well at all!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try a lighter weight and smaller type counter top mixer. MY MISTAKE! This mixer was a waste of money! Does a very poor job of blending, mixing and whisking. Blender and whisk attachments do not touch sides so you spend a lot of time manually scraping and mixing not not you have when using a Kitchenaid counter top mixer! Also blades do not touch the bottom of the mixing bowl so you have to manually scrape and mix. A BIG DISAPPOiNTMENT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for making Macarons. I tried making chocolate chip cookies with it but it armed to struggle a bit. The manual says to turn it up higher for cookie dough but it started to sound like it was grinding gears. Not too big an issue because I can easily hand mix cookie dough when it starts to get thick. If you're not whipping more than 4 egg whites the whisk doesn't seem to touch near the bottom of the bowl either. But thy was easily fixed by adding some folder paper towels under the bowl to raise it. Other than that, good investment and not at all as expensive or bulky as the Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Ben

customer_reviews.title: TOO much Clearance.
customer_reviews.text: I like the clean appearance but Compared to my old Kemore 12 Speed this mixer is much louder. I attribute that to the extra power. Again, comparing it to the old mixer, this one is difficult to add/blend ingredients without stopping, raising the paddle because when the mixer head is in the "Down position" there's limited space between the head and the top of the bowl. The lack of clearance also inhibits "scrapping down" during mixing. Excessive clearance betweent bottome of bowl and paddle does not completely mix the ingredients on the bottom without raising the head and using a spatula to scrap the bottom of the bowl. Would I recommend this mixer? NO!
customer_reviews.author: Old and Still Kicking

customer_reviews.title: good machine for the price. very happy customer here !
customer_reviews.text: been baking on this almost every weekend for almost 6 months and still going strong,, pizza dough, bread, cookies. i knead my dough in it too/// now this is no kitchenaid so lower the expectations a bit / you do get a good machine for the prices, but not the strongest motor and sometimes depending on the load will make some weird sounds but don't panic it's going to be ok / only 3 attachments will work with it so again no kitchenaid attachments for pasta or ice cream etc etc / for people trying to start baking, look no further ! this is a good one
customer_reviews.author: digital15

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: This does not compare to a kitchen aid mixer, but is great for beginners, and people who dilly dally in baking. I can make better baked good with my hand and whisk then with this mixer. Its loud shakes and doesnt mix well at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: After using this mixer 5 times now in total, I would NOT recommend it. It does NOT hold up, even for the simplest of cake mixing. 2 jello cakes, a batch of cookies, a cheesecake batter and it literally broke apart into my the bowl while mixing the second cheesecake batter. Single recipes each. Very disappointed and will NOT be buying this again. I will be investing in another kitchenaid mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Athina Tennant

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine and made a batch of cookies. The mixer is such a relief to my hands! I used a handheld electric mixer until now and let me tell you IT IS HARD to macaroons with that thing. But there was no way I'd spend hundreds of dollars on a mixer which I'll use occasionally. This model was perfect for my needs and fit in my budget. Only thing I wished if there were more colors to choose from but that's not a big deal for me. I also got the 4 year warranty (hoping I'll never have to use it). I'll update if things change with the mixer
customer_reviews.author: Tashnuva

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday and it's great! There are only two of us so I didn't want to spend the money on the larger KA stand mixer. It's pretty much for cake and cookies and I won't be doing anything heavy with it. Super little space saver mixer and the beater does go to the bottom of the bowl. Mine sticks very nicely to the counter with the 4 sticky cups on the bottom. For those who are having problems with it walking, I'd just get some shelf liner and put it on that.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sparke

customer_reviews.title: An ok mixer
customer_reviews.text: So first things first. This product is not absolutely perfect. You definitely cannot clean the mixing parts in the dishwasher as other people have stated. Just like other people have stated, you will find gray stuff rubbing off and won't want to use it on your food anymore. I bake a lot, so I was excited to get a stand mixer, but this one did not hold up to the abuse. It would be a perfect little machine for someone who bakes as a hobby, but it will bog down with most bread doughs. Otherwise, this can be used for simple cake recipes, cookies, icing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: firemedic2008

customer_reviews.title: Struggles with bread dough
customer_reviews.text: I only used this a few times before I returned it. It's a fine mixer, and for the price I have no complaints. My only problem with it is that I bought it to help me make bread dough, and it really struggles with that. With softer things like cookies, cakes, whipping cream, puddings, etc, it's totally up to the job. With dough, the motor starts to bog down and the whole body starts to flex back and forth from the stress. No hard feelings towards the designers: they made a great mixer for the lighter items on a baking list. For dough, unfortunately, you really need a steel body and a pretty stout motor, which is more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: I love this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer. I have to make my own homemade bread because I'm gluten free (and the store bought gluten free bread can be awful). This is perfect for gluten free bread dough which is very thick and sticky and has to be beaten for several minutes at a time.
customer_reviews.author: D M

customer_reviews.title: Cake: Yes! Bread: No!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the whipping cream or making a cake, clearly unsuitable for working with heavier dough, like sourdough. Made about one loaf/week for ca. 2.5 years and it needs to be replaced now as the transmission is done. I still like the machine, but motor and transmission are clearly too weak for my use case, ymmv. I will get a different, stronger one as replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, works well!
customer_reviews.text: Girlfriend loves it, and has baked 12 times in the last month(cookies and cupcakes for work and parties). Much easier for her, much faster, and she won't admit this publicly, more consistent. Much cheaper than others, replacement parts are cheap, and it even has some AMAZINGLY strong suction cups on the bottom. She set it down on the center island to look at it and I almost had to cut it off to get it to come up.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: but it doesn't look like it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer over a month ago, but haven't had a chance to use it. I finally put it to use today, making Christmas cookies for Santa. While the mixing function works well, the push button that allows the head of the machine to lift up is broken already. The head will lift, but it doesn't look like it's supposed to. It's kind if awkward and difficult to hold the head up with one hand, and scrape the sides of the bowl/add ingredients with the other. Rather disappointed we didn't even get one complete use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: i LOVE this machine
customer_reviews.text: i LOVE this machine! it fits perfectly in my small space. the motor is strong enough to mix and knead a 1.5 lb loaf of bread easily. i don't think it scrapes the sides very well and i find i do actually have to stop it, pop the top up and remove the bowl to scrape down the sides. the way the bowl fits in the base and the fact that i can't spin the bowl while the arm is down i find very annoying, but it's worth the trade off of power and compact footprint.
customer_reviews.author: mizztanya

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 34 days
customer_reviews.text: Got this mixer for my wife and it broke immediately after the return window closed. It still mixes (for now), but the button that locks it into the upright position no longer works (it stays pushed in and wont lock unless you manually grab it with your fingers and pull it out, as is visible in my picture). Really disappointed in Hamilton Beach; i figured since they were a big name that their quality control would be better than this. I strongly recommend avoiding this mixer, and Hamilton Beach products in general.
customer_reviews.author: Bolt Vanderhuge

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased to receive my mixer. I have been wanting a mixer that is not real heavy, but yet works well. Does not have the power that I would like, but it still works well. I knew this when we ordered it. I just can't see paying the hundreds of dollars for other brands. So far I am truly enjoying my mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Good starter stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good starter stand mixer! Doesn't scrap sides and bottom as well during mixing, so I usually have to stop and scrap sides with spatula, but overall does what i need it to do. Wish it had a splatter guard with a spout for adding ingredients though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Lacked power when mixing thick substances. Worked well for ...
customer_reviews.text: Lacked power when mixing thick substances. Worked well for light mixing. 60 bucks is a lot of money for such mediocre performance. We ended up purchasing a KitchenAid 6 qt. professional series. Higher cost, but it is a true workhorse and should last many years. It would have been smarter for us to skip this Hamilton Beach and start of with the KitchenAid instead....
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Does Good Job and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Hamilton Beach 6-speed now for well over a year...and every day. I have a dog kennel and do doggy muffin mix every morning for my guys. This mixer not only does a thorough job, but stands up to the demands put upon it.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after three uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in December only used it three times. As you can see it's still in its original box and plastics. It worked well the first three times. Had a funny smell the third time, I assumed it was because of the hot motor. Was in the process of making a cake and it never came on. Please help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its working fantastic, its sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am literally been using this for an year now, for almost everyday to knead dough for chapatis, naan, cake batter, bread batter etc. and till now i have not encountered any problem. Its working fantastic, its sturdy, easy to clean, and more importantly its in budget as compared to its kitchen aid counterpart. I would recommend this to anyone looking for regular purpose.
customer_reviews.author: ritika

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, fair price - don't be a snob
customer_reviews.text: This works almost as well as the very pricey competitors. It's effective, reliable, and user friendly. It's very simple to change tools, and it's surprisingly stable. If you can't decide whether to get this or something that costs hundreds of dollars, let me save you some trouble - just get this. You'll be extremely happy with it. The only real reason for one of the high dollar ones is if you're one of those people who feels they need to impress everyone by having the biggest name of everything (you know who you are). For the rest of us who like excellent quality at a fair price, I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MAZ

customer_reviews.title: MIXER NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.text: My hand mixer was cheaper, more efficient and much easier to use. Simple blending of ingredients like mashing potatoes or using bread/cake mixes become a MESS with clogged beaters as they swirl around the bowl. The suction cup base makes it very difficult to pry loose for cleaning, If I had kept my box I would return this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia A

customer_reviews.title: would be nice if it came with more than one size bowl
customer_reviews.text: works well but does not always mix to the bottom of bowl stopping and using a spatula to stir up the batter on the bottom and then restarting solves the problem. would be nice if it came with more than one size bowl.
customer_reviews.author: tio48

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't match description. Requires constant maintenance while mixing, cheaply made, etc. Buy a kitchenaid instead.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: Little parts can break.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price, I haven't had any issues with the attachments. One of the plastic bits that hold the bowl in place broke however, so not the bowl wobbles if the mixer goes very vigorously. It broke while mixing pizza dough on speed 2. I hope I can fix it because it's not good for dough anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had this for 3 years and I love it. All the extra beaters are great too
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for 3 years and I love it. All the extra beaters are great too. Love the dough hook. I didn’t want to spend the money on a kitchen aide so I bought this one and couldn’t be happier with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: mziem

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, does what a mixer should!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO VERY HAPPY with this purchase. Now the claim that the paddle attachment is configured to make it so that you don't have to scrape the sides down is a major exaggeration, but nothing can be perfect right? When you are paying this price compared to the Kitchen-aid, you have to adjust expectations, mine were exceeded. I might revise my review when I try to make meringues, we'll see if it holds up to that test, but so far (several cupcake batters later) it does everything I need it to do and saves my arm muscles from aches from creaming butter and sugar by hand! Love love love, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: After reading a lot of reviews decided to try this and couldn't be happier. After 7 months and probably a good 70 ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a chef and I always wanted a kitchen aid mixer. Just always had other things to spend the $300 on. After reading a lot of reviews decided to try this and couldn't be happier. After 7 months and probably a good 70 uses this is still going strong and has yet to disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Big E

customer_reviews.title: Decent for beginners
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a decent purchase for anyone the beginner home cook. This will do small batches of cookie and some dough recipes. However for anyone who is above a beginner level I recommend saving your money for a kitchen aid. The motor itself in this is a fine motor but the plastic construction makes it so the motor loses power and torque.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister as a thank you gift (since she is obsessed with baking) back in May 2015. This product is still going strong and is in new condition, which is really surprising because my sister uses it at least every other day. I borrow it anytime that I have an event (such as a birthday party or holiday) where I need my baking to be on point. Now that my mixer has quit working, I plan on buying one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bramon

customer_reviews.title: easy to use stand mixer to use with my 6-year-old ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight, easy to use stand mixer to use with my 6-year-old son who is hooked on cooking and baking TV shows. This has been perfect. The size is just right and the attachments all work well. It is easy to move around the kitchen and easy to clean up. It isn't too loud or messy either. A great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fetscher

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I have it out several times a week
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have it out several times a week. No, it's not a kitchen aid. Those are way better, but they are also really expensive. This one is cheap and works well. You'll have to scrape the sides of the bowl (and bottom) with a rubber spatula sometimes, but considering the price...
customer_reviews.author: J. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mixer for about 3 years now Love It..... I Do Baking as a side job And There has been days this mixer has gone all day for me... It can Handle Tough Jobs As Bread doughs, Fondants, I have filled the bowl to just about to the top and it Always gets the job done. Now that my baking business has picked up, My husband wants to buy a new mixer for me the only reason I will get one is for a bigger bowl.. And then I will keep this one to the side because I'm sure it will be still going strong for me also.. GREAT MIXER....
customer_reviews.author: Ettalee

customer_reviews.title: Replacement wasn't any better
customer_reviews.text: I bought a replacement in March for the 1st one that I had bought a few months earlier. Again, while making granola, the motor bogged down and then quit. So, I'm past being able to return it and out $80. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: BillieJo Hartjes

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I simply love it! If you are not a professional, no need for spending a lot of money to purchase a KitchenAid. I am very happy with everything I make on it. CON: With one of the tools, sometimes it doesn't get all the "material" I put inside the bowl, so I have to stop and use a spoon or something to push it to the middle. But it has only happened once or twice I can recall.
customer_reviews.author: Thadeu M.

customer_reviews.title: ... brand other than kitchen aid but it works as great as any other
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy it from a brand other than kitchen aid but it works as great as any other. It was a good use of money and the dough gets kneaded beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tariq

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: My wife always wanted the kitchen aid stand mixer but we could never justify the cost for how often we would use it. So for mothers day I was looking for an alternative and I picked this one. We love this thing. It's not perfect - it's a little loud and when you're doing thicker dough it is flexing and twisting but.....this puppy keeps turning. For the price, you can't beat it with a stick. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Not paid to write this

customer_reviews.title: A Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new mixer so I went with this Hamilton Beach model. We couldn't be happier with it. Very sturdy construction and should last a very long time. Now to make that spicy cheese bread!
customer_reviews.author: Eric B. Burres

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I brought the mixer for my husband who likes to bake and make bread. He has done both and the only complaint was that he wished there was more room between the bowl and the top of the mixer. It's difficult to add dry ingredients while mixer blade is moving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer. Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer. Works well for me. I’m not a heavy baker. Bowl is nice and deep. Speeds work fine and have plenty to choose from. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This has been an ideal "starter" stand mixer for me. I recently got my grandmother's pound cake recipe and it needed a stand mixer to make. This is working just fine. It mixes well and it is reasonably easy to clean. My only take back is that the suction cup feet make it a challenge to move.. so in the sense that they work REALLY well...
customer_reviews.author: CindyLou Whoiswayover 2

customer_reviews.title: When I use this product, it doesn't mix ingredients ...
customer_reviews.text: When I use this product, it doesn't mix ingredients well at the bottom of the bowl. I have tried several different items in this--cake batter, pie filling, pudding, roll dough, brownie batter, and each time, I have to incorporate the dry ingredients from the bottom of the bowl. I know that you need to scrape down the sides and stir the batter/dough while its being mixed, but its as if its not being touched at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shynsweet

customer_reviews.title: It's great for most mixing/baking projects
customer_reviews.text: It's great for most mixing/baking projects, but it's a bit light on the power and not quite strong enough to kneed more than one small loaf of white bread, wheat bread is out of the question. I had to exchange the first one because the gears stripped out.
customer_reviews.author: rgreene

customer_reviews.title: Buying a Sunbeam
customer_reviews.text: If I would have known that is thing had suction cups on the base, i wouldn't have ordered the stupid thing. Shakes violently on the counter when in operation.
customer_reviews.author: nhotwater

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic mixer and I am so happy I went with this one instea if spending lots of money on the kitchenaid mixer! Easy to clean and gets the job done. The bowl it comes with is a good size for typical use. I made a cake with it the other day to break in the new mixer and it did what it needed to do. It's not terribly noisy and the mixer is a good weight which I like. I had a sunbeam that was 20 years old that finally died so that's the reason I bought this one. I didn't think it could compare but I'm so happy it broke because this mixer rocks :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love,love,love. Does everything I I need it to do without spending over $200 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Hanshaw

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: It's great. Gave it to my daughter in law for a birthday gift. Works pretty much just like my Kitchen Aid mixer. Has the same beater rotation. Bonus: it comes with a smaller price tag! She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Rubi Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Actually pretty good
customer_reviews.text: So far so great. My daughter loves this. She asked for a stand mixer but I couldn't afford the big name one. She seems to love and use this one just as well. She's already made several batches of cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke douglass

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I only used it once and had a lot of trouble mixing completely the ingredients. I do the same thing with a manual mixer for a 3rd of the cost, in half of the time and using less space at my counter. Returning it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really love the mixer
customer_reviews.text: Really love the mixer! I bought it because i only had this really old hand mixer that I have been using for forever. This stand mixer allowed me to bake so much. I really like the different type of attachments for different purposes. The only problem was that for speed 4 and 5, the mixer make a horrible noise that's really hard to bear and also the whisk attachment doesn't reach all the way to the bottom which doesn't really bother me that much.
customer_reviews.author: ok?

customer_reviews.title: so this mixer has been worked pretty hard and remains reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to the fairly expensive KitchenAid stand mixers. I use it almost exclusively for making dough, which I make a lot of, so this mixer has been worked pretty hard and remains reliable. It comes with a few attachments, including a decent dough hook. For the price, it's a pretty reliable appliance, so I'd certainly recommend it as an alternative if you're not really interested in paying the premium price for a KitchenAid stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: elorc

customer_reviews.title: Hot garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute trash. Motor slows and gets loud when trying to mix a dough and rocks back and forth. Each time I think something is going to crack or it may start smoking. It’s just not powerful enough. The quality is of a $35 mixer, not almost $100. Doesn’t mix everything in the bowl, doesn’t even get close to the bottom or sides, so you have to scrape multiple times. The tops of the attachments are flat and catch your ingredients as you pour them in. It’s just garbage. We end up doing everything by hand anyway. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jo Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: Works well but extremely loud. Don't use when someone is sleeping
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this mixer. Its everything she wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this mixer. Its everything she wanted from a Kitchen Aid without the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mellen

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a KA
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier. Yes, you can knead bread dough just like a KA can. Yes, you can also tear up your machine if you don't watch, JUST LIKE a KA can. The secret to longevity is to be sure and do an autolyse. Things like banana bread are a cinch to do, and homemade whipped cream, buttercream, etc are a dream to make and not murder on the hands. Now I can finally follow along with Gretchen over at the Woodland Bakery :D No, the mixing bowl is not 5 quarts, nor does the bowl have an awesome handle, but for the price I can live with that. Hamilton Beach actually lived up to the claims on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Jono G.

customer_reviews.title: One of my most fav kitchen item!
customer_reviews.text: I have sent it to my mom In Pakistan and Sister in UK. love love love it!
customer_reviews.author: Fizzy Jay

customer_reviews.title: It was working well at first. Suddenly, while ...
customer_reviews.text: It was working well at first. Suddenly, while I was using it, it completely stopped. And I called customers service they told me to email them some information and I did 3 days ago! And I didn’t get anything back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nouf

customer_reviews.title: The little machine that could..
customer_reviews.text: Im so happy with this mixer. I wanted something smaller but with plenty of power and this is it. Im used to kitchen aids however i needed something small and lightweight as my counterspace is minimal. Good power, easy to clean. I dont think it will have the same lifespan as a kitchenaid, however for 90 bucks i can handle that. The base is plastic and metal so at first i thought it might be cheaply made, however it has good power and the paddle attachment works well in the bowl, less scraping needed than with a kitchen aid.
customer_reviews.author: Kel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made. Beaters don't reach bottom of the bowl so mixing ingredients was very difficult. The attachments didn't lock into the mixer very dangerous. Following use of bread hooks the mixer literally fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: NanaJan

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two batches of cookies, but then it would no longer transition from low to high speed. So it was either off or on full blast, making for quite a mess! The only gave 3 stars instead of 1 or 2 is that Amazon was great about sending a replacement. I've only used the new one once so far, but I'm not too confident that it will be a long-lasting product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cornett

customer_reviews.title: ... this three times and all three times it worked beautifully. I’ve made batches of brownies and cookies and ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this three times and all three times it worked beautifully. I’ve made batches of brownies and cookies and it makes my mixing so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Toua

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: As a newbie baker, I did not want to spend a fortune on a mixer. This product is amazing and does everything I need it to do. My daughter and granddaughter loves this as well! I know what to get her in the as a gift. I HIGHLY recommend this brand!
customer_reviews.author: PS Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a friends 90 year old mother who loves baking chocolate layer cakes She was thrilled with the quality presentation and approved the price
customer_reviews.author: crazyeye

customer_reviews.title: I love it. works great
customer_reviews.text: I love it. works great , very well make.works like kitchen aid but so much cheaper price. and shipped fast.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES WOOLDRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: OK for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well, but not as good as Kitchenaid. When it gets to higher speeds on tougher foods the whole unit moves. I got what I paid for essentially. Will eventually move up to the other brand if I use it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought thus because I make cookies and muffins once a week or so, and have limited space, so must put it away every time. It needed to be light as I can't lift much with arthritis. It is perfect. I don't need maximum power and even so, this mixer beats egg/sugar/butter just fine, doesn't have any issues at all with speed or power, one just must be patient. As someone who worked with a hand mixer before, it's obviously a huge step up.. But why in the world spend $400?
customer_reviews.author: Carter7

customer_reviews.title: So this product worked great the first couple of times then only the highest ...
customer_reviews.text: So this product worked great the first couple of times then only the highest speed worked after that.... VERY disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M.

customer_reviews.title: UNDER POWERED MOTOR
customer_reviews.text: MOTOR STRAINS TO DO THE JOB ON JUST A CAKE MIX AND IT SMELLS LIKE IT IS BURNING! I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS FOR HOME USE!
customer_reviews.author: BOBMc

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used now for a few months. Good for the price. I mainly bought to make Macarons so this is perfect machine. But lacks a little power if using for thicker cookie dough. You do have to scrape down sides to incorporate. But for what I needed it for, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: USA customer

customer_reviews.title: We both felt the quality was terrible. Buttons and connections should work smoothly--especially when the ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it I started to make a cake, however, the button jammed and I couldn't get the cake batter out of the bowl! My husband was able to get the button to stop jamming, but then the beater got stuck. We both felt the quality was terrible. Buttons and connections should work smoothly--especially when the mixer is brand new!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really don't know what the folks who had a bad experience with dough were trying to do
customer_reviews.text: Made my first batch of bread today. I really don't know what the folks who had a bad experience with dough were trying to do. I guess it might be some cases of "when all else fails, read the instructions". It breezed through a batch of heavy dough without breaking a sweat. Nice and quiet. I did get the black and chrome model which may make SOME difference. For the price, it's a great appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barry/Richard L Barry

customer_reviews.title: Average stand mixer
customer_reviews.text: After almost 3 years of using it. It died. Pros: easy to clean, inexpensive and a good a gift idea. Cons: Not very strong motor to do any heavy duty baking like a kitchenaid mixer. Overall if you're doing basic and light baking and mixing it will do the job. If you over work it, it will die. I gave it over all 3 stars. It's not terrible but it isn't good.
customer_reviews.author: John Dizon

customer_reviews.title: Good Product..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as a gift for my mother-in-law who loves to bake! Ideally I would have loved to buy a Kitchen Aide mixer but honestly didn't want to spend that kind of money. I browsed through Amazon and found the Hamilton Beach mixer and was impressed with the good reviews. My mother-in-law was thrilled! The mixer looks good and comes with a few attachments! If you fire up the mixer you will realize it is VERY loud! Not a big deal though... it does function well and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey W.

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes, EPIC FAIL
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this mixer. It worked the first two times. When I tried to use it a third time, the mixer would only work when the dial is turned to maximum speed, all other speeds don't work. What a piece of junk, and now I am past my Amazon return date. Waste of hard earned MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Kkkk

customer_reviews.title: Met expectation and beyond
customer_reviews.text: I could've bought a kitchenaide or a cuisenart but went with this Hamilton instead due to other's stellar reviews. I'm glad I did. This little machine has done everything I've asked for it to do with no problem. It's easy to operate and came with all the basic tools needed, all for a mere fraction it would cost if I bought a kitchenaide. Simply a great value. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MonTex

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as its $300 counterpart like it claims but gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: This is really the perfect option for those on a budget! The only thing is that the fitting that is on the top of each beater attachment does get a bit of rust, if they could make that all stainless steel it would be 5 star. Oh, and the rusty part never gets in your food, it's way in the top of the fitting, so don't let that deter you, or you could use food grade mineral oil on it before you use it for the first time to probably prevent that from happening :)
customer_reviews.author: SplendidThings

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the value!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty similar to a more expensive version of stand mixers. However, the quality of the materials used for the top part of the inserts is poor. Plastic split into two after a few uses. Still works, and the rest of the mixer does the job for the value.
customer_reviews.author: Briseida Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: People are saying that they were having residue from the dough hook I am not have any of those problems it works wonderfully very powerful and smooth mixing very compact and lightweight an excellent by for a novice or time to time baker or beginners 😾
customer_reviews.author: Alfred M.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. Returning today and will be getting a ...
customer_reviews.text: Standing mixer broke within 30 days of purchasing. The attachment for locking and changing tools became loose. After putting in a bit and flipping the switch on, the attachment clicks and causes the mixer to jump about and bang on the counter. Horrible product. Returning today and will be getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Yates

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a good value, specially for occasional use and small batches. Quite noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Rashider

customer_reviews.title: I love my new Hamilton Beach mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton Beach way surpassed my expectations. Very well built, loads of power. I have used it numerous times for different recipes and everything comes out perfectly mixed, light weight bowl for pouring into cooking pans. I have recommended mixer to a friend and she ordered one and is very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Retta

customer_reviews.title: A bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It works well, very light, easy for me to put up on top of the shelves with 1 hand. Suction cups keep it anchored to the table. However, when mixing something very tough, it gets bogged down easily, and the arm will sometimes pop up if it is mixing something that is too stiff. For the price it is pretty good, and you can get around its limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous123

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much. It's perfect to make my swiss meringue buttercream. Big enough for 2 batches too
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Gilbreath

customer_reviews.title: ... forever is calls for parts to be replaced just like any other product
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen Aid is expensive and it doesn't last forever is calls for parts to be replaced just like any other product , this mixer is cheaper it works really well .... I saw a lot of people commented you have to stop the mixer and scrape down the sides , well from experience with most mixers of that size you have too , amazingly it still does a fantastic job I recommend this 100%
customer_reviews.author: kathija m.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to yse
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this mixer. It is easy to clean and the has low noise. My daughter (13) uses it the most. Very easy to use! A touch smaller than I thought it would be. But we are enjoying it very much!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Can't go wrong worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I love my mixer early Christmas Gift I baked four pies, and three cakes yesterday. Once I received it love this mixer already, only thing I don't like is it's noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Devoria Murray

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine on February 14, 2017.I do have kitchen Aid mixer too and this little one is very competitive after 3 years she is very strong and I do love how she mix meringues. Although the whisk was completely separate all the part But I manage to put back with strong glue and she is very very helpful in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: jesus

customer_reviews.title: very very disappointed. i got busy with a feath in the ...
customer_reviews.text: after a couple of months of working ok for mostly just one recipe - a thin batter chocolate cake - the whisk attachment completely fell apart into the batter. broke into pieces. very very disappointed. i got busy with a feath in the family, set it aside and never dealt with it. went back, bit the bullet, spent the money and got a good old reliable kitchen aid.
customer_reviews.author: L'via Weisinger

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 6 Speed Electric Stand Mixer with Stainless Steel 3.5 Quart Bowl, Planetary Mixing, Tilt-Up Head (63325), 300 Watt Motor, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:BlackHamilton Beach stand mixers save you time and energy while providing outstanding baking results. All Hamilton Beach stand mixers are designed for tough mixing and can handle even the thickest cookie or bread dough. Whatever stand mixer you choose, a variety of attachments are included from traditional and wire beaters to dough hooks.
feature_bullets: Same Mixing Action as Kitchenaid Mixers*. Planetary Mixing Action Rotates the Beaters Around the 3. 5 Quart, Stainless Steel Bowl, for Even and Complete Bowl Coverage. No Scraping Necessary.
Baking With Ease: Effortlessly MIX Thick Batters and Doughs Like Breads, Cookies and More With a Powerful, 300w Motor.

6 Speeds With Fold Setting: Six Speeds Let You Go From a Slow Stir to a Fast Whip, With Precise Control at Each Level. Plus, a Special Fold Setting Lets You Gently Add Ingredients Without Over-Mixing.
Tilt-Up Head: Provides Optimal Bowl Access to Easily Add Ingredients and Quickly Change Attachments.
Mixing Versatility: Includes Dough Hook, Whisk and Flat Beater. All Three Attachments Are Dishwasher-Safe.
* Kitchenaid Is the Registered Trademark of Whirlpool Properties Use of the Kitchenaid Trademark Does Not Imply Any Affiliation With or Endorsement by Kitchenaid or Whirlpool Properties

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,055 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
